nodes.body: :v: ocfnash can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).

I think our CI is currently flaky and nothing is queued so I'm trying yet again.

bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

  Build succeeded!

  The publicly hosted instance of bors-ng is deprecated and will go away soon.

  If you want to self-host your own instance, [instructions are here][instructions].
  For more help, visit [the forum].

  If you want to switch to GitHub's built-in merge queue, visit [their help page][gh].

  [instructions]: https://github.com/bors-ng/bors-ng#how-to-set-up-your-own-real-instance
  [the forum]: https://forum.bors.tech
  [gh]: https://docs.github.com/en/repositories/configuring-branches-and-merges-in-your-repository/configuring-pull-request-merges/managing-a-merge-queue



  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/5929779612/job/16078155334)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/5929779612/job/16078155498)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/5929779612/job/16078154955)
I've made a start via suggestions, but I think a lot of the arguments to these lemmas should be explicit.

```suggestion
def invert : R[T;T⁻¹] ≃ₐ[R] R[T;T⁻¹] := AddMonoidalgebra.domCongr k k <| AddEquiv.neg G

@[simp] lemma invert_T {n : ℤ} : invert (T n : R[T;T⁻¹]) = T (-n) := AddMonoidalgebra.domCongr_single _ _

@[simp] lemma invert_apply {f : R[T;T⁻¹]} {n : ℤ} : invert f n = f (-n) := rfl
```
then you can drop the dependency on #6496 (and the questions of star-canonicity that that PR runs into)

```suggestion
def invert : R[T;T⁻¹] ≃ₐ[R] R[T;T⁻¹] := AddMonoidAlgebra.domCongr k k <| AddEquiv.neg G
```
Can you make this `scoped` notation in the Laurent files? (either in this PR, or a spin-off if you'd prefer)
Can you add the related lemma that `(invert (R := R)).symm = invert` (which I think is `rfl`?)
Do you think it's worth having `X_pow` versions of these too?

I don't think this should be a `simp` lemma; [`polynomial.coeff_C`](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib_docs/data/polynomial/basic.html#polynomial.coeff_C) is analogous and also not `simp`.
Oh nevermind, I guess this is consistent with `MvPolynomial`.

```suggestion
@[simp] lemma C_apply {t : R} {n : ℤ} : C t n = if n = 0 then t else 0 := by
  rw [← single_eq_C, Finsupp.single_apply]; aesop
```
```suggestion
@[simp] lemma C_apply (t : R) (n : ℤ) : C t n = if n = 0 then t else 0 := by
  rw [← single_eq_C, Finsupp.single_apply]; aesop
```

```suggestion
@[simp] lemma T_apply (m n : ℤ) : (T n : R[T;T⁻¹]) m = if n = m then 1 else 0 :=
```

I think it's nice to make it obvious where the interesting version was actually proved here:
```suggestion
theorem _root_.Polynomial.toLaurent_comp_C : toLaurent (R := R) ∘ Polynomial.C = C  :=
  funext Polynomial.toLaurent_C
```

```suggestion
@[simp] lemma invert_T {n : ℤ} : invert (T n : R[T;T⁻¹]) = T (-n) :=
  AddMonoidAlgebra.domCongr_single _ _ _ _ _
```
The suggestion is identical to the original here but I'm assuming you intended to suggest turning `{n : ℤ}` into `(n : ℤ)`.

```suggestion
@[simp] lemma invert_apply (f : R[T;T⁻¹]) (n : ℤ) : invert f n = f (-n) := rfl
```

```suggestion
@[simp] lemma invert_C (t : R) : invert (C t) = C t := by ext; simp
```
I'm not convinced by this lemma vs `rw [char_poly, charmatrix]` at the caller.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: characterise the reverse of the characteristic polynomial of a matrix

source.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: nilpotent matrices have nilpotent trace
